text:
Do you know how to make a chaincode log to a standard output? I tried instructions from `<https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/master/docs/Setup/logging-control.md>` and when I check a peer console I can't see any log messages generated by the chaincode ... In other words, the following does not work:
```
var myLogger = shim.NewLogger("AssetChaincodeLogger")
  [...]
<http://myLogger.Info|myLogger.Info>("Init() called ...")
```
<@U3AECURPZ> do you have any idea concerning the logging of error messages of invoke statements using hfc sdk ?
<@U3BSMKS21> I still don't understand why I am not able to log anything to a console ...
i somehow have the impression that it is completely impossible for invoke statements to return anything in hyperledger v0.6

<@U3AECURPZ> You need to run the chaincode with Debug mode ON. 
Ex : GRPC_TRACE=all DEBUG=hfc   etc
I can currently make external HTTP calls through user chaincode. Is this intended behaviour?

If there are 3 endorsing peers for a chain and a transaction is Proposed from a client using his signature, is it possible for the chaincode that is endorsing the transaction, to know the identify of the client? I would like to ensure that only an authorized client is allowed to make a given transaction.
